page.title: 15PRIORS HOUSING ESTATE
page.content: FOUR CHILDREN FROM HOLY TRINITY SCHOOL WENT TO LOOK AT THE{PRIORS ROAD ESTATE WHICH WAS BUILT IN 1966. ON THE WAY WE STOPPED AT A{CORNER SHOP}AND TALKED TO THE LADY WHO RUNS IT. SHE TOLD US THAT MOST OF THE CUSTOMERS ARE SCHOOL CHILDREN WITH ANYTHING FROM 5p TO Â£1 TO SPEND. THEY SOLD SWEETS, PAPERS, EGGS, BREAD AND WERE REALLY A{SMALL {GROCERS SHOP.}WE WEREN'T ALLOWED TO BUY ANY SWEETS IN SCHOOL TIME. WE WALKED ALONG THE ROAD PAST THE BACK OF THE CEMETERY. THERE IS A{PARK}AND A {PAVILION}THERE BY THE SIDE OF G.C.H.Q. THERE IS A{BROOK}IN THE PARK AND IT{FLOODS}WHENEVER THERE IS HEAVY RAIN. THE PEOPLE ON THE ESTATE AND IN WHADDON ARE FED UP WITH THE FLOODING. ALL THE ROADS ON THE ESTATE ARE NAMED AFTER{FAMOUS BATTLES.
